channel.title: Firecape = death :)

item.title: Firecape = death :)
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

jc22493:

No it would not. If the player has a firecape, it will add another. That means that the player will end up with two.

The ApplyDead method removes all your items so you wont have 2 firecapes.

Read full topic

item.title: Firecape = death :)
item.dc:creator: @noobspure50 noobspure50
item.description:
@noobspure50 wrote:

[quote=“o.O O.o, post:7, topic:276732”]If the question has not yet been answered, set a boolean for having the cape(on, in your inventory, whichever is to your preference), then if that’s true, delete and add the firecape, otherwise don’t bother with it.[/quote] erm, the firecape alraedy stays on death im asking is that the right area to work with for other items, I want a differnt item to stay when you die, adding on to what you already keep

Read full topic

item.title: Firecape = death :)
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

If the question has not yet been answered, set a boolean for having the cape(on, in your inventory, whichever is to your preference), then if that’s true, delete and add the firecape, otherwise don’t bother with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Firecape = death :)
item.dc:creator: @mad_moparscapian mad_moparscapian
item.description:
@mad_moparscapian wrote:

[quote=“jc22493, post:5, topic:276732”][quote author=mad_moparscapian link=topic=365385.msg2771883#msg2771883 date=1241196426]

//If killed apply dead if (IsDead == true && NewHP <= 1 && playerHasItem(6570)) { ApplyDead(); addItem(6570, 1); sendMessage("Oh dear you died...Have a firecape to keep you on fire!"); }

Fixd

Yea that would work
[/quote]
No it would not. If the player has a firecape, it will add another. That means that the player will end up with two.

if(playerHasItem(6570)){ keep6570 = true; }[/quote]

IIght Chill, I’m not the best coder in the world lol

Read full topic

item.title: Firecape = death :)
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“mad_moparscapian, post:4, topic:276732”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=365385.msg2771840#msg2771840 date=1241194193]

//If killed apply dead if (IsDead == true && NewHP <= 1 && playerHasItem(6570)) { ApplyDead(); addItem(6570, 1); sendMessage("Oh dear you died...Have a firecape to keep you on fire!"); }

Fixd
[/quote]

Yea that would work :p[/quote]
No it would not. If the player has a firecape, it will add another. That means that the player will end up with two.

if(playerHasItem(6570)){ keep6570 = true; }

Read full topic

item.title: Firecape = death :)
item.dc:creator: @mad_moparscapian mad_moparscapian
item.description:
@mad_moparscapian wrote:

Why don’t you just do this.

//If killed apply dead if (IsDead == true && NewHP <= 1) { ApplyDead(); addItem(6570, 1); sendMessage("Oh dear you died...Have a firecape to keep you on fire!"); }

However this would give you a firecape when you die if you didn’t have one.

Read full topic

item.title: Firecape = death :)
item.dc:creator: @noobspure50 noobspure50
item.description:
@noobspure50 wrote:

just wondering before i fuck with this is this the right codes to make an item keep on death? if(playerHasItem(6570)){ keep6570 = true; deleteItem(6570, 1); }[/code and this idk what ones right [code] if(playerHasItem(6570)){ keep6570 = true; deleteItem(6570, 1); }
and this

if (keep6570) { addItem(6570, 1); keep6570 = false;[/code]
